meanings.definition: Relating to or characterized by the use of multiple keys or tonalities simultaneously.
meanings.sent1: The composer created a polytonal piece by blending different keys together.
meanings.sent2: The polytonal nature of the music gave it a unique and complex sound.
meanings.sent3: The polytonal painting combined various colors to create a harmonious effect.
meanings.sent4: Her polytonal personality made her both introverted and extroverted at the same time.
meanings.sent5: The polytonal landscape was a beautiful mix of mountains and rivers.

meanings.definition: Music that uses multiple keys or tonalities at the same time.
meanings.sent1: The orchestra performed a polytonal piece that showcased their versatility.
meanings.sent2: Listeners were amazed by the intricate layers of the polytonal composition.
meanings.sent3: The polytonal melody seemed to dance playfully between different keys.
meanings.sent4: His speech had a polytonal quality, shifting between seriousness and humor.
meanings.sent5: The polytonal symphony painted a vivid musical picture in the audience's minds.
